body_html:
Hello again, I downloaded the Official MNIST scripts and tried running them but I got an ImportError: No module named official.mnist. I went to the Tensorflow Official models website (found here <https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official#running-the-models>), and tried to follow the directions under the Requirements section. However, I learned that these directions are only for Linux. Are there additional directions available for Windows systems? Thank you.
…
On Sat, Aug 4, 2018 at 12:07 PM, Karmel Allison ***@***.***> wrote: It's hard for me to help debug without the code, data, and the like. Maybe start from scratch with the Official MNIST <https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official/mnist>, and see if you can get that running? — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#20997 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AZZjtHgEFGJfxxV8VNXAsKVpj8kQAXx3ks5uNcbAgaJpZM4VYT0n> .
-- Markus Ville Tiitto, Pharm.D. PhD Student Clinical & Experimental Therapeutics Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences University of Kentucky, College of Pharmacy Lee Todd, Jr. Building Rm 466 789 S. Limestone St. Lexington, KY 40536 VilleTiitto2@gmail.com markus.tiitto@uky.edu (412) 296-9192
body_text:
Hello again,

I downloaded the Official MNIST scripts and tried running them but I got
an  ImportError: No module named official.mnist.

I went to the Tensorflow Official models website (found here
<https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official#running-the-models>),
and tried to follow the directions under the Requirements section. However,
I learned that these directions are only for Linux. Are there additional
directions available for Windows systems?

Thank you.
…

body:
Hello again,

I downloaded the Official MNIST scripts and tried running them but I got
an  ImportError: No module named official.mnist.

I went to the Tensorflow Official models website (found here
<https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official#running-the-models>),
and tried to follow the directions under the Requirements section. However,
I learned that these directions are only for Linux. Are there additional
directions available for Windows systems?

Thank you.



On Sat, Aug 4, 2018 at 12:07 PM, Karmel Allison <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> see if you can get that running?
